<small>Also see: **<big>[[H8032|שִׁלְשׁוֹם]]</big>** | **<big>[[H8008|שַׂלְמָה]]</big>**</small>

 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תְּמוֺל‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎(תּמֹלׅ‎</span><sub>23</sub>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶתְמוֺל‎</span><sub>5</sub>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֹתְּמוֺל‎</span> [[1Sam.10.11|1Sam 10:11]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶתְּמוֺל‎</span> [[Isa.30.33|Isa 30:33]]; [[Mic.2.8|Mic 2:8]] (see infinitive), **substantive**, used sometimes as **adverb accusative**, ==yesterday==, figurative ==recently, formerly== (Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִתְּמָלֵי‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תְּמָלֵי‎</span>, sometimes <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אִתְּמוֺל‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> Mandean <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עתמאל‎</span> [[BDB#Nö|Nö]]<sup>M 202</sup>; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***timâli, itimâli, ina timâli***</u></abbr> ([[BDB#Dl|Dl]]<sup>158, 721</sup>); derivation dubious; according to [[BDB#Me|Mei]]<sup>Gr. Syr. 118</sup> [[BDB#Kö|Kö]]<sup>ii. 264 f.</sup> from Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> II. ***prolongavit***, IV. ***longam vitam concessit***, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***tempus***, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***the two times***, i.e. night and day, in form an infinitive of VI. <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; hence properly ***long time***, (past) ***time***, specialized to ***yesterday); — yesterday***, but usually figurative= ***recently*** or ***formerly:*** 

**1.** [[2Sam.15.20|2Sam 15:20]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תְּמוֺל בּוֺאֲךָ‎</span> ***yesterday (=only lately)*** was thy coming, [[Job.8.9|Job 8:9]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תמול אנחנו‎</span> (of) yesterday ([[BDB#Ges|Ges]]<sup>«GKC:141d»§ 141d</sup>) are we, [[Ps.90.4|Ps 90:4]] (genitive) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּיוֺם אֶתְמוֺל‎</span>. 

**2.** usuually in combination with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שִׁלְשֹׁם‎</span> ***yesterday*** (and) ***the third day***, to express the idea of ***formerly:*** thus 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** as ***adverb accusative (a)*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎גַּם תְּמוֺל גַּם הַיּוֺם‎</span> [[1Sam.20.27|1Sam 20:27]] (literal), compare [[Exod.5.14|Exod 5:14]] (sub **b**); ***(**b**)*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תְּמוֺל שִׁלְשֹׁם‎</span> [[Exod.5.8|Exod 5:8]]Ruth [[Exod.2.11|Exod 2:11]], so <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶתְמ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁ‎</span> [[1Sam.4.7|1Sam 4:7]] ***(c)*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎גַּם שׁ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎גַּם ת‎</span> [[2Sam.3.17|2Sam 3:17]]; [[1Chr.11.2|1Chr 11:2]] (\|\| [[2Sam.5.2|2Sam 5:2]] with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶתְמ‎</span>). 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בִּתְמוֺל שִׁלְשֹׁם‎</span> ***as formerly*** [[Gen.31.2|Gen 31:2]]; [[Gen.31.5|Gen 31:5]]; [[Exod.5.7|Exod 5:7]]; [[Josh.4.18|Josh 4:18]]; [[1Sam.21.6|1Sam 21:6]] (but [[BDB#Bu|Bu]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִתְּ‎</span>, as **c**), [[2Kgs.13.5|2Kgs 13:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כְּאֶתְמ‎</span> [[1Sam.14.21|1Sam 14:21]]; [[1Sam.19.7|1Sam 19:7]]; [[Exod.5.14|Exod 5:14]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כִּת‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎גַּם תְּמוֺל גַּם הַיּוֺם‎</span> ***as yesterday*** (and) ***the third day (= as formerly)***, both yesterday and to-day ***(=so more recently).*** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִתְּמוֺל שׁ‎</span> = ***(form) aforetime***, [[Exod.21.29|Exod 21:29]]; [[Exod.21.36|Exod 21:36]]; [[Josh.3.6|Josh 3:6]], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְהוּא לֹא שׂנֵא לוֺ מִתְּ‎</span> [[Deut.4.42|Deut 4:42]]; [[Deut.19.4|Deut 19:4]]; [[Deut.19.6|Deut 19:6]]; [[Josh.20.5|Josh 20:5]] so <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֵאִתְּמוֺל שׁ‎</span> [[1Sam.10.11|1Sam 10:11]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎גַּס‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎גַּס מִשּׁ‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִתְּ‎</span> [[Exod.4.10|Exod 4:10]]. 

**3.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֵאֶתְמוּל‎</span> (alone) [[Isa.30.33|Isa 30:33]] ***from yesterday = already***; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְאֶתְּמוּל עַמִּי‎</span> [[Mic.2.8|Mic 2:8]] corrupt, read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְאַתֶּם לְעַמִּי‎</span> (WRS, with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יָקוּם‎</span>; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַמִּי‎</span> [[BDB#We|We]] [[BDB#Now|Now]], with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תָּקוּמוּ‎</span>), and see <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שֵׂלְמָה‎</span>.
